website_summaries.verdict: A glitchy gearshift detracts from an otherwise smooth ride, and the frame tends to run large.
pros: Plenty of mounting points for accessories (not included) like a cargo rack
cons: Assembly can take a few hours and quite a bit of fiddling with small parts
Shifting isn’t smooth, even after derailleur tuning

customer_reviews.title: Quality Bike
customer_reviews.text: I've only had the bike for a week, but i definitely made a good choice selecting this model. I went with the Medium and it's a perfect fit. I'm 5'8" with a 30" inseam and the top tube is about a 1/2" underneath me while standing. Assembly was pretty easy. Didn't have to follow the instructions, but based on briefly reviewing them, they seemed straight forward. I took the bike out for a spin and and fine tuned the brakes to my liking. I do like the fact that you only need a 6mm allen to make most adjustments. I'd highly recommend buying this model.
customer_reviews.author: Quev

customer_reviews.title: Great bike after some fixes
customer_reviews.text: This bike rides nice and is just what I was looking for, a bike for general fitness. I had problems with the gears not working and Raleigh were not much help. They just said take it to a bike shop and have it set up. Well you know this is not my first bike and I have done this with many bikes. Anyhow shame on Raleigh and I bought some special tool for hanger alignment and fixed the problem myself. Bike ride great now. Seat not very comfortable but my rump will toughen up.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Missing Instructions; missing tools; bent front fork.
customer_reviews.text: My 1st bike in almost 35 years. New bike arrived in battered box. No parts list, no assembly instructions and no tool kit for assembly. I had some metric allen wrenches, but no thin metric open-ended wrenches. Looked up the assembly instructions online. Installed handle-bars, seat and pedals ok. When I got to attaching the front wheel, something looked wrong. (I sure hope the instructions that are supposed to come with the bike are better than the online ones). At this point, I contacted a top-notch bike shop to complete assembly and left it with them. They said front fork was bent.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew W. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: Ok so i believe im the first one to buy this bike. At first glance its really nice looking. Looks really expensive from close and far. However, the frame is a little thicker than what is pictured. I had to do a couple of adjustments to the deraileurs. Took about 45 minutes to put togather. The hardest part were the brakes. Dosent really have an instruction manual on how to put togather like other bikes i have botten here on amazon. It is heavier than i expected but then again its lighter than most bikes by a little bit. About 26 pounds. Ill update during the upcoming months..
customer_reviews.author: Ivanuclear

customer_reviews.title: Really like this bike
customer_reviews.text: Really like this bike, it has replaced my car and I commute 12-18 miles five days a week on it. Only make sure to get your derailer adjusted, mine needed adjusting right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: biosocker

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike for the Price
customer_reviews.text: The bike was pretty easy to assemble, me being inexperienced in the bike world. The bike itself rides very well but I can feel the gears grind in the lower gears, but that could definitely be due to user error as I am not quite sure on how to diagnose bike issues. I would definitely recommend this as a reliable commuter bike!
customer_reviews.author: iruleman

customer_reviews.title: So far great bike for the money
customer_reviews.text: So far great bike for the money. I almost gave it a 4 star because there are no instructions on putting the bike together. Most of it is self explanatory, however the brakes weren't the easiest to figure out if you haven't done something like this before. Bought it for my wife, and she loves it so far, but will update as need be.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Oberg

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this bike, he is 6" tall and 200 pounds, rides smooth
customer_reviews.author: Esther Orbera

customer_reviews.title: great "around town" rider
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike. It does run a bit large, I am 5' 10" and have longer legs, I purchased the large. I can straddle the bike no problem, but there isn't much room (reminds me of my first "nice" bike when I was a teen. Gears were a bit harsh, but I brought it to my local bike shop and they fin tuned them. Great bike, great ride, great purchase for a recreational rider.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great!! Best bike I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as displayed, great!! Best bike I've ever had, excellent deal!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dan the Man

customer_reviews.title: Good bike for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'10 with 30" inseam and the medium size fits just right, if your having questions about what size to get then measure your inseam to be sure what size fits you. The bike rides smooth and feels solid so no complaints there. Assembly is generally easy but if you have never tuned a derailer or fit and adjusted brakes then that might compel you to visit a bike shop.
customer_reviews.author: Dubrik

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with a rear derailment which was defective. After ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with a rear derailment which was defective. After building the whole bike and taking it for a ride I saw this issue. I was not going to take the whole bike apart again to return it so I got it replaced at a bike shop myself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Went together like a dream
customer_reviews.text: Went together like a dream. Super comfortable and exactly what we expected. Can't wait to enjoy this baby for years to come in the city and on the trails.
customer_reviews.author: Nap2727

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Quality components. Need to connect brakes out of the box which may be a bit tricky for the average person.
customer_reviews.author: yojimmy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this bike. Been years since I was on one. But it is a great deal
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kuc

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike. I've had it for about 2 months ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bike. I've had it for about 2 months now and now complaints. Was fairly simple to assemble. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: rsparky1219

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Rides great, not too difficult to assembly. Really like it.
customer_reviews.author: King of the World

customer_reviews.title: Product arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived with a derailleur that was snapped completely in half. This makes the bike completely useless and I am unable to ride it at all without investing significant time and energy and money into repairing it myself.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Wonwook Kim

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bike for recreational riding! Very comfortable and effortless to use on all the nearby bike paths.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Corey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great bike. Light, and all the right attributes and gears to get me around the boroughs of NYC.
customer_reviews.author: david duvet

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike! Perfect for riding and commuting in the city!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great hybrid bike for a beginning cyclist looking to put ...
customer_reviews.text: Great hybrid bike for a beginning cyclist looking to put in miles. The price is right and it has a cool vintage look. I had it shipped to my local bike shop and had a professional put it together.
customer_reviews.author: JenW

customer_reviews.title: The instructions to put this bike together is a joke ...
customer_reviews.text: The instructions to put this bike together is a joke. They just give you a video and no actual instructions. I have to go buy a special bike pump for it after spending all this money. I'm not very happy
customer_reviews.author: Casey

product_meta.title: Raleigh Cadent 1 Urban Fitness Bike
product_meta.description: The cadent 1 is the entry-level bike in raleigh's urban fitness line. Whether you are looking for a fun ride down the local greenway or through the city on your way to work the cadent 1 is your perfect companion. 700C wheels keep the ride quick and efficient while flat handlebars and a sporty geometry keep the ride comfortable. 35C tires are fast rolling and smooth, but are wide enough to provide traction for an enjoyable path ride, organized ride, or your commute. Mechanical disc brakes are easy to maintain and provide the stopping confidence to get out and navigate all your city has to offer. With 21 speeds, rack and fender mounts, and strong double wall wheels you'll always be equipped for your next two-wheel adventure. Raleigh bicycles are designed around one simple idea: fun. It's an idea that inspired the very first bikes way back in 1887 and continues to inspire how things are done today. Hop on a Raleigh and enjoy the ride
feature_bullets: Perfect for rides around town, organized rides, the bike path, or commuting to work
Lightweight and durable aluminum frame keeps you more upright to better see the road ahead of you without stressing your neck and lower back
Shimano parts flow through the 21 gears making shifting a breeze no matter what terrain is ahead of you
700x35c fast rolling tires are Big enough to keep momentum going and wide enough to keep traction on the different surfaces of your city streets
